related.title: Then and Now: Change in Isla Vista After May 23
related.description: Distraught I.V. residents protest outside IV Deli, urging news crews to leave their community.
related.content:
On the left, thousands of students and I.V. residents gathered together at Manzanita Beach for an Isla Vista Paddle Out Memorial on May 28, 2014. On the right, the beach on a typical quiet day.


On the left, police officers gather at a crime scene near the Loop Apartments in the aftermath of the May 23 shootings. On the right, Pizza My Heart is filled with patrons on an evening.


On the left, distraught I.V. residents protest outside IV Deli, urging news crews to leave their community. On the right, IV Deli’s windows advertise the establishment’s various deals.


On the left, police officers taped off the final crash site of the shooter’s black BMW on Del Playa Drive. On the right, a row of cars is parked at the street corner.


On the left, a segment of Trigo Road in front of the Loop Apartments is taped off. On the right, an Amazon store has closed for the evening.

related.title: In Photos: 32nd Annual Santa Barbara International Film Festival
related.description: Held in various venues across downtown Santa Barbara, this year’s Santa Barbara International Film Festival was one for the books. Groundbreaking works such as ‘Loving’, ‘Moonl...
related.content:
Held in various venues across downtown Santa Barbara, this year’s Santa Barbara International Film Festival was one for the books. Groundbreaking works such as ‘Loving’, ‘Moonlight’, and ‘La La Land’ were honored throughout the week, and the stars of these films lit up the central coast skyline.

Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
Loving actor Ruth Negga was one of eight actors awarded the Virtuosos Award at the Santa Barbara International Film Festival. Jose Arturo Ochoa / Daily Nexus
Moonlight actor Mahershala Ali (right) was one of eight actors awarded the Virtuosos Award at the Santa Barbara International Film Festival. Jose Arturo Ochoa / Daily Nexus
Lion actor Dev Patel was one of eight actors awarded the Virtuosos Award at the Santa Barbara International Film Festival. Jose Arturo Ochoa / Daily Nexus
Fences actor Stephen McKinley Henderson was one of eight actors awarded the Virtuosos Award at the Santa Barbara International Film Festival. Jose Arturo Ochoa / Daily Nexus
Hidden Figures and Moonlight actor Janelle Monáe was one of eight actors awarded the Virtuosos Award at the Santa Barbara International Film Festival. Jose Arturo Ochoa / Daily Nexus
Nocturnal Animals actor Aaron Taylor Johnson was one of eight actors awarded the Virtuosos Award at the Santa Barbara International Film Festival. Jose Arturo Ochoa / Daily Nexus
Ryan Gosling on the red carpet. Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
SBIFF Executive Director Roger Durling. Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
Cara Santana. Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
Ava DuVernay. Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
Emma Stone was awarded the Outstanding Performers Award, alongside Ryan Gosling. Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
Damian Chazelle was one of the many awarded the Outstanding Directors of the Year Award. Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
Jesse Metcalfe with fiancé Cara Santana on the red carpet. Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
The Cinema Vanguard Award honored Casey Affleck and Michelle Williams. Min Xie / Daily Nexus

related.title: In Photos: Deltopia Weekend 2017
related.description: The Nexus takes a look at this year's Deltopia, Isla Vista's informal street party.
related.content:
2017 marks the seventh year of Deltopia, Isla Vista’s annual Spring Break celebration on Del Playa Drive. This past weekend saw 6,000 to 8,000 people attend the informal street party, with 42 arrests, 68 citations and 14 medical transports, still down from the 20,000 to 25,000 attending, 130 arrested, 190 cited and 50 medically transported in 2014.

A UC Santa Barbara student fell off an oceanside balcony Saturday afternoon and sustained “moderate injuries,” authorities said.

Associated Students Program Board hosted on Saturday night its third annual installment of The Warm Up featuring artists RL Grime and Destructo.

Photos by Daily Nexus photographers

A female student fell off a cliff Saturday and was taken to the hospital where she was treated for “moderate injuries.” The student was one of 14 medical transports on Saturday. McLane Brown / Daily Nexus
RL Grime performed in the ThunderDome Saturday night as part of A.S. Program Board’s The Warm Up. Francisco Barrera / Daily Nexus
Deltopia crowds were estimated to be as low as 6,000 and as high as 8,000. McLane Brown / Daily Nexus
While crowds were larger than last year, they were significantly lower than in 2014, when approximately 20,000 to 25,000 people attended. McLane Brown / Daily Nexus
Some on the I.V. Community Service District (CSD) Board of Directors believe that a sanctioned event with a festival ordinance would make the community and its students safer, especially after the 2014 Deltopia Riots. McLane Brown / Daily Nexus
Police shut down approximately 12 parties on Saturday due to safety concerns and alleged law violations. McLane Brown / Daily Nexus
Police walked through Isla Vista patrolling the Saturday party scene. Deltopia 2017 saw 42 arrests and 68 citations. McLane Brown / Daily Nexus
This is the first year Deltopia fell on the same weekend as Spring Insight, a day for prospective students to come to UCSB and learn about the university. As a result, UCPD opted to not use fencing on El Colegio and around residence halls. McLane Brown / Daily Nexus
The Warm Up’s RL Grime concert sold out to 6,000 students. Francisco Barrera / Daily Nexus
This is the seventh year Deltopia has taken place on Del Playa Drive, after the county closed access to the beaches for Floatopia, the original Spring Break party. McLane Brown / Daily Nexus
